metadata.synopsis: After a difficult fight and defeating Gortash, Karlach stands over the battle and accepts - for the first time - that permadeath is coming for her.
metadata.how_to_trigger: With Karlach in your party, fight Gortash and defeat him.Using the origins debug book:1. Load BGO_Main_A2. Recruit Karlach3. Karlach -> Gortash Confrontation -> Kill Bodyguards4. Karlach -> Gortash Confrontation -> Teleport to Gortash"5. Start fight and defeat Gortash

112.speaker: Wyll
112.text: I think she needs a moment to herself.

23.speaker: Minsc
23.text: You are wise, Boo. Let us... give her a moment.

44.speaker: Karlach
44.text: So Gortash is nothing more than a pile of flesh, same as the rest of us.

7.speaker: Karlach
7.text: Why doesn't it feel like I won? Why do I just feel so godsdamn tired?

55.speaker: Karlach
55.text: Is that it, then? I've killed the bastard who ruined my life, and now I crawl into a corner and die?

14.speaker: Karlach
14.text: I did whatever it took to get what I wanted. Just like he would've.

74.speaker: Karlach
74.text: Where's my sunset to ride off into? My bard to play me off stage...?

12.speaker: Karlach
12.text: Nothing's coming, is it? I killed the bastard who ruined my life, and my prize is that I get to crawl into a corner and die.

148.speaker: Karlach
148.text: Calm down. You must've known this was the only possible ending.

27.speaker: Karlach
27.text: Knowing and believing aren't the same thing. Not by a long shot.

24.speaker: Karlach
24.text: This is it. This is what we worked so hard for.

21.speaker: Karlach
21.text: It makes no sense. None of it means anything.

56.speaker: Karlach
56.text: He... he wasn't even sorry for hurting me so fucking bad.

120.speaker: Karlach
120.text: I'm still dying. I'm dying. He killed me! I'm going to die!
120.context: NodeContext: Finally breaking down emotionally, beating chest with one hand, evoking the infernal engine that's killing her.

89.speaker: Karlach
89.text: I'm not dead yet. Not yet. Not yet.

121.speaker: Karlach
121.text: For how much longer? Long enough to finish what you started? Long enough to get back your heart? Fat fucking chance.

97.speaker: Karlach
97.text: I don't want to die. Please, no.

87.speaker: Karlach
87.text: It isn't fair. I was so young when... so naive. They stole my. Heart.

73.speaker: Karlach
73.text: My heart. My heart. It was mine! From my mother. From mum.

26.speaker: Karlach
26.text: There's still hope. I can fix the engine. Stabilise it.

5.speaker: Karlach
5.text: Please! Fucking give it up. There's no miracle coming. There's no hope. You can die here in your home, or you can go back to being tormented in fucking Hell. Those are your two options.

43.speaker: Karlach
43.text: I'm going to be as dead as Gortash any day now. Any moment. And what then?

76.speaker: Karlach
76.text: Off to the City of Judgement to waste into oblivion? Into the dirt to get eaten by maggots? Is that it for me?! Is that fucking all?!

128.speaker: Karlach
128.text: And the others - they'll just keep going. Singing, dancing, loving each other, all of it, all of it, without me.

151.speaker: Karlach
151.text: That's my reward for everything I suffered. That's why I survived ten years of torment. The fighting, the clawing, the loneliness, the fucking loneliness...

8.speaker: Karlach
8.text: All of it, so I could rot. Because the person I trusted - I loved that fucking animal - gave me away to the devil.

118.speaker: Karlach
118.text: What the fuck am I supposed to do now?
118.context: CinematicNodeContext: Suddenly she has burnt through her rage and sorrow moves in its place. She crumples, and the tears begin.

156.speaker: Karlach
156.text: I should just end it all now. On my terms.

117.speaker: Karlach
117.text: But then who'd save this fucking place.
117.context: NodeContext: With a smile, breaking her own awful mood

9.speaker: Karlach
9.context: NodeContext: Exhausted, this is a bit of droll response to the player telling her to live with the time she has left. It has an essence of humor, though she's still devastated

114.speaker: Karlach
114.text: All right. I think I can do this. Time to... keep going.
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns back toward peanut gallery, ready to leave.NodeContext: Chuckling.

61.speaker: Karlach
61.text: Protect the city I love, I guess.

48.speaker: Karlach
48.text: The 'Absolute' can have Baldur's Gate when I'm dead. Which may be in the next few minutes, but until then, no.
48.context: NodeContext: Mock unwillingness, like a teen agreeing to come down to dinner after crying it out with her mom. Good humoured, but one last moan of indignity.

105.speaker: Karlach
105.text: There's nothing to know. There's nothing left.

154.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
154.text: Vengeance can be a bitter tonic to kind hearts. Give her a moment.
154.context: NodeContext: sympathetic, soft. Genuinely cares about Karlach, who is the 'gentle heart' of this moment

116.speaker: Shadowheart
116.text: Karlach? Talk to me - what's the matter?

155.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
155.text: Your vengeance is complete, Karlach. You should rejoice.
155.context: NodeContext: encouraging an ally who is despondent despite a victory

123.speaker: Minsc
123.context: NodeContext: trying to step lightly around his clearly upset friend.

86.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
86.text: Your vengeance is complete, Karlach. Do you not feel joy?
86.context: NodeContext: confused by an ally's lack of enthusiasm after killing a villain. Sincerely concerned

98.speaker: Karlach
98.text: I'm going back to camp. If I don't immolate in the night, I'll deal with this sorry shit tomorrow.

139.speaker: Karlach
139.text: So Gortash is nothing more than a pile of flesh, same as the rest of us.

6.speaker: Karlach
6.text: I don't feel like I've won. All I feel is tired.

59.speaker: Karlach
59.text: Is that it, then? I've killed the bastard who ruined my life, and now I crawl into a corner and die?

152.speaker: Player
152.text: This is all a lot to take in. It's no wonder you're overwhelmed.

153.speaker: Karlach
153.text: I'm beyond overwhelmed. I'm... I'm finished.

20.speaker: Karlach
20.text: It makes no sense. None of it means anything.

138.speaker: Karlach
138.text: He's dead, and he's no fucking sorrier now than he was before.

125.speaker: Karlach
125.text: What was the point? I'm still dying. I'm dying. I'm going to die!
125.context: NodeContext: Finally breaking down emotionally, beating chest with one hand, evoking the infernal engine that's killing her.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: But you're not dead yet. I'm here with you, and I will be until the very end.

51.speaker: Karlach
51.text: Don't say that. Say you found some way to fix me. That now Gortash is dead, I'll get my heart back.

16.speaker: Karlach
16.text: My heart. It was mine, and they took it.

85.speaker: Karlach
85.text: I'm going to be as dead as Gortash any day now. Any moment. And what then?

99.speaker: Karlach
99.text: Off to the City of Judgement to waste into oblivion? Into the dirt to get eaten by maggots? Is that it for me?! Is that fucking all?!

36.speaker: Karlach
36.text: And you - you'll just keep going, won't you. Watching the stars. Warming your hands on the campfire. Dancing, eating, making fucking love all night - all of it, all of it.

34.speaker: Karlach
34.text: That's my reward for everything I suffered. That's why I survived ten years of torment. The fighting, the clawing, the loneliness, the fucking loneliness...

137.speaker: Karlach
137.text: All of it, so I could rot. Because the person I trusted the most gave me away to the devil.

69.speaker: Karlach
69.text: It isn't fair. I don't want it like this.
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Suddenly she has burnt through her rage and sorrow moves in its place. She crumples, and the tears begin.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: I would do anything to change it, but I just can't.

15.speaker: Karlach
15.text: You could try. Haven't you got a Wish spell in that pack of yours?
15.context: NodeContext: gallows humor. Wish spell is the most powerful in the world.

141.speaker: Karlach
141.text: What the fuck am I supposed to do now?

144.speaker: Player
144.text: I don't know. But whatever it is, I think we're meant to do it together.

19.speaker: Karlach
19.text: I ought to just end it all now. On my terms.

52.speaker: Karlach
52.text: But then who'd save this godforsaken town.
52.context: NodeContext: With a smile, breaking her own awful mood

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Live. For as long as you can.

30.speaker: Karlach
30.context: NodeContext: Exhausted, this is a bit of droll response to the player telling her to live with the time she has left. It has an essence of humor, though she's still devastated

129.speaker: Karlach
129.text: Let's get out of here. I've always hated this place. Stupid fucking gigantic bridge or whatever.

165.speaker: Karlach
165.text: I think I need to go to camp for a while. Be alone. Scream at the sky. You can come and find me later, if you want to.

11.speaker: Karlach
11.text: Thanks for listening. For existing. Love you.

72.speaker: Karlach
72.text: You might only find a pile of ash, but I'll be there all the same.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Protect Baldur's Gate until your dying breath.

143.speaker: Karlach
143.context: NodeContext: Mock unwillingness, like a teen agreeing to come down to dinner after crying it out with her mom. Good humoured, but one last moan of indignity.

93.speaker: Karlach
93.context: NodeContext: Crying, but also laughing a little. She really just doesn't know.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Pray Karlach's soul will be looked after in the afterlife.

84.speaker: Karlach
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player bows their head in prayer; Karlach follows suit. After a little, she looks up and speaks.

71.speaker: Karlach
71.text: You better be right or I'll haunt your arse.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: They grant my power; perhaps they'll grant this prayer.

147.speaker: Karlach
147.text: Not exactly encouraging. But I'll take what I can get.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: I'm a cleric; I have to say yes.

113.speaker: Karlach
113.text: I guess I'm not the only one bound by something beyond my control.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: Ask for a miracle; that Karlach's life be saved.

96.speaker: Karlach
96.text: That's a big ask. You in good with the powers that be?

91.speaker: Karlach
91.text: Well then. Maybe I have a chance after all.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I still have access to my magic, so they haven't given up on me yet.

149.speaker: Karlach
149.text: Thanks for not giving up on me, either.

124.speaker: Karlach
124.text: I should've yoked my fate to a better cleric.
124.context: NodeContext: gentle ribbing. She's still emotionally cut up but ready to joke

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Just close your eyes and tell the gods what you're feeling. Some among them will understand.

146.speaker: Karlach
146.context: CinematicNodeContext: She closes her eyes and bows her head in prayer.

133.speaker: Karlach
133.text: I begged one of them to claim my soul. Hoping for Lathander or Selûne, but at this point I've probably done more to earn Loviatar's interest.
133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Opens one eye and looks up mischievously.NodeContext: Still sad but back to being a little cheeky

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Let it out. It's about time.

83.speaker: Karlach
83.text: I don't want to die. I want to live. I want to stay.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: It is what it is. It's time to soldier forward with the time you have left.

78.speaker: Karlach
78.text: I deserve better. I deserve more. I deserve to live. I. Deserve. To. LIVE.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: We're all going to die one day. In the end, we're all the same.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I don't want you to die. It makes no sense.

164.speaker: Karlach
164.text: It's evil. I was so young when this fucker betrayed me. So naive. They stole my heart before I even knew what I had.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Maybe we can still fix your engine; stabilise it.

29.speaker: Karlach
29.text: Got a miracle in your back pocket you forgot to tell me about?

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Karlach, it doesn't need to be this way. You can still return to Avernus.

60.speaker: Karlach
60.text: I don't want to go back to Hell! I shouldn't have to! I want to live - I want to live here, in my home, with my own heart.
60.context: NodeContext: Responding to the player suggesting she could return to Avernus to avoid dying. She doesn't want to consider this and it irritates her to be reminded of it.

158.speaker: Karlach
158.text: I can't do it anymore. Ten years, man. It's enough. It's enough.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Life isn't fair. Get used to it.

68.speaker: Karlach
68.text: Fuck you! Fuck him and fuck you! I don't need life to be fair, I just need to live it!

54.speaker: Karlach
54.text: Feel like I should laugh but I'm just too godsdamned tired.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: You can sense she's working something out; say nothing.

131.speaker: Karlach
131.text: I feel like there should be a sunset for me to ride off into. Or an orchestral swell or... something.

62.speaker: Karlach
62.text: But there's nothing, is there? I killed the bastard who ruined my life, and my prize is that I get to crawl into a corner and die.
